page.title: 04SUPERSTITIONS
page.content: Over many years superstitions have been passed down through generations and still exist today.Long ago{rowan trees were planted outside the front door to ward off{witches,}the door lintels were also put in upside down so the witches couldn't read the writing on them. At{harvest time}the last sheaf of corn was hung up until a mare had a foal.The mare was then given the sheaf.The farmworker who took in the last sheaf was barked at and clumps of {earth}were thrown at him. A sea monster called{Nuckalvee,}was offended when the people burned{kelp he vented his anger by smiting the horses on the island of Stronsay with a deadly disease called Mortasheen.
